explains: adj. 一对一的；直接对立的

sentences.en: Talking one-on-one with people is not his idea of fun.
sentences.cn: 他一点儿都不喜欢一对一的交谈。

sentences.en: The one-on-one music therapy sessions each lasted 60 minutes and took place twice a week.
sentences.cn: 一对一音乐治疗课程每次持续60分钟，每周进行两次。

sentences.en: Holloway was beaten in a one-on-one with Miklosko just before half-time.
sentences.cn: 比赛进行到快一半时，霍洛韦在跟米克洛什科一对一的较量中告负。
